page.title: 08FARMING IN PAXFORD AREA (2)
page.content: Grassland is for summer grazing,hay and silage,some in large bales in plastic bags.4 Friesian herds contain 15,90,95&115 cows.Milk is collected daily by tanker to a Milk Marketing Board Depot where it is pasteurised and bottled.Any surplus is made into butter,cheese etc.Due to over production the M.M.B.(who have a monopoly)impose a quota system.A levy is charged on excess.Other stock are 2 flocks of 500 & 150 sheep for fat lamb production and 2 herds of beef cattle,either fattened on the farm or sold as stores at Stratford or Banbury Market.There are no working horses but 17 are kept for riding or breeding. Farming is thriving in this area but threats of over production may be partly solved by one of the wettest seasons that can be remembered.
